documentation.text: @dev Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.

@dev Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to account[0] (the token owner´s account)
 until the hold is executed or returned.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.

@dev Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to account[0] (the token owner´s account)
 using the allowance mechanism until the hold is executed or returned. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.

When the method is executed the money is transferred from the on hold balance to the wallet
  where the hold was instructed.
  It can only be executed by the same address that created the hold.
  Emits a {Transfer} event.

Returns the money on hold and all the balance is available for transfers.
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.
  Emits a {Transfer} event.

Returns all the address holds
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract or the address that created the holds.

Returns all the holds
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.

Returns the hold data
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.
@dev Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.

@dev Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to account[0] (the token owner´s account)
 until the hold is executed or returned.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.

@dev Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to account[0] (the token owner´s account)
 using the allowance mechanism until the hold is executed or returned. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.

When the method is executed the money is transferred from the on hold balance to the wallet
  where the hold was instructed.
  It can only be executed by the same address that created the hold.
  Emits a {Transfer} event.

Returns the money on hold and all the balance is available for transfers.
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.
  Emits a {Transfer} event.

Returns all the address holds
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract or the address that created the holds.

Returns all the holds
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.

Returns the hold data
  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.

devdoc.details: Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.

hold(uint256,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to account[0] (the token owner´s account) until the hold is executed or returned. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

holdFrom(uint256,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to account[0] (the token owner´s account) using the allowance mechanism until the hold is executed or returned. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

cancelHold(uint256).notice: Returns the money on hold and all the balance is available for transfers.  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.  Emits a {Transfer} event.

executeHold(uint256).notice: When the method is executed the money is transferred from the on hold balance to the wallet  where the hold was instructed.  It can only be executed by the same address that created the hold.  Emits a {Transfer} event.

getHold(uint256).notice: Returns the hold data  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.

getHolds().notice: Returns all the holds  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract.

getUserHolds(address).notice: Returns all the address holds  This function can only be called by the owner of the contract or the address that created the holds.
